summary.para: Computes the modulus, with the same results as the Python modulus, for each pair of corresponding elements from the input tensors, placing the result into the corresponding element of OutputTensor.
Because the quotient is rounded towards -inf, the result will have the same sign as the divisor.
This operator supports in-place execution, meaning that OutputTensor is permitted to alias one of the the input tensors during binding.

member.name: DML_ELEMENT_WISE_MODULUS_FLOOR_OPERATOR_DESC.ATensor
member.summary: A tensor containing the left-hand side inputs.

member.name: DML_ELEMENT_WISE_MODULUS_FLOOR_OPERATOR_DESC.BTensor
member.summary: A tensor containing the right-hand side inputs.

member.name: DML_ELEMENT_WISE_MODULUS_FLOOR_OPERATOR_DESC.OutputTensor
member.summary: The output tensor to write the results to.
